line_1: The informer's part her generous soul abhorr'd,
line_2: Though life preserv'd had been the sure reward;

line_1: Yet all his Wives would surely be abhorr'd,
line_2: And some common Lais be ador'd.

line_1: To wind the slimy track abhorr'd! —
line_2: Fate is mine, since mine the SWORD!

line_1: Thou hast not my low State abhorr'd;
line_2: MY Soul extols the mighty Lord,

line_1: Perish the virtue, as it ought, abhorr'd,
line_2: And the fool with it that insults his Lord.
Rome shall perish — write that word

line_1: And thou grim Pow'r, by Life abhorr'd,
line_2: While Life a pleasure can afford,

line_1: Fir'd him to brave the Myriads he abhorr'd,
line_2: Wing'd his unerring shaft, and edg'd his victor sword.

line_1: O Harold, be this cruelty abhorr'd!
line_2: And 'gainst the powerful turn thy conquering sword.

line_1: Make millions wretched, and thyself abhorr'd; —
line_2: O'er plunder'd realms to reign, detested Lord,

line_1: O'er dog-ey'd lust the tort'ring scourge abhorr'd,
line_2: On Europe's sons to wreak the faithless sword

line_1: " Atchieve exploits by earth and heaven abhorr'd.
line_2: " That turn the ploughshare to a murd'rous sword,
